
Running this example on RHEL 7.2 (assume same for centos), and using _hostPath_, I get a permissions error when the mysql container does a `chown -R mysql:mysql ...`. If I set selinux to permissive on the host it works. If I manually run the container with `-v  /tmp/pv-1:/var/lib/mysql:Z` it works. I was _not_ able to get it to work when adding `securityContext.seLinuxOptions.type=svirt_sandbox_file_t` to the deployment.

My fix was to locate the PVs in `/tmp/data` by changing the _local-volumes.yaml_ file, and doing `chcon -Rt svirt_sandbox_file_t /tmp/data`.
I added this comment to _local-volumes.yaml_:

```
# If using hostPath on selinux systems the mysql container will not be able to chown /var/lib/mysql
# due to a permissions error. To remedy this without setting selinux to permissive on the host:
#   1) place the PVs in /tmp/data rather than directly in /tmp:
#      on host: `mkdir -p /tmp/data & chmod a+rwt /tmp/data`, and
#   2) on host: `chcon -Rt svirt_sandbox_file_t /tmp/data`
```

If this issue is valid I will create a quick PR to doc this selinux solution.
title: examples/mysql-wordpress-pd fails on selinux systems
